info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 10:43PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ... Thunderstorms with heavy rain and frequent lightning will impact portions of southeastern Pondera, northwestern Judith Basin, south central Liberty, eastern Teton, western Chouteau and northeastern Cascade Counties through 1130 PM MDT... At 1033 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking multiple thunderstorms with heavy rainfall and frequent lightning across western Chouteau and eastern Cascade Counties moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. Heavy rainfall and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT... Ponding of water on roadways and in areas of poor drainage from heavy rainfall. Locations impacted include... Great Falls, Fort Benton, Belt, The Knees, Geyser, Highwood, Black Eagle, Carter, Floweree, Raynesford, Portage, Sluice Boxes State Park, Malmstrom Afb, Stockett, Tracy, Centerville, Shonkin, Armington and Sand Coulee. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
